required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of Oral GW572016 In Advanced Or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Multicenter Trial Comparing Two Schedules of GW572016 as First or Second Line Monotherapy in Subjects With Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer With Either Bronchioloalveolar Carcinoma or No Smoking History

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to evaluate and compare the efficacy of two dose schedules of an oral investigational drug for the treatment of advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Based on interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment was stopped due to lack of efficacy

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor Response in the Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Disease progression and tumor response (number of participants achieving a complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]), using standardized criteria (Response evaluation criteria in solid tumors). CR, disappearance of all target lesions; PR, 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease, 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; stable disease, small changes that do not meet above criteria. Disease assessment was done at baseline and then every 8 weeks after starting treatment, until the participant discontinued treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Four Months in the Targeted Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks up to four months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants in the Targeted Population, at 4 months after starting study drug, who were alive and without disease progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Four Months in the Non-Targeted Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks up to four months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants in the Non-Targeted Population, at 4 months after starting study drug, who were alive and without disease progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants Who Showed Certain Biomarkers in Their Serum or Tumor Tissue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to disease progression (for serum biomarkers) or until analyses of tumor tissue samples
secondary_outcome.description: To further characterize the participant population, these biomarkers could be tested: serum levels of ErbB1 and ErbB2; intra-tumoral expression of ErbB1, ErbB2, etc.; mutations in ErbB1, ErbB2, and k-ras. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, serum biomarkers were not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to time of PK period completed: Day 1 (first dose) and Days 2, 28, and 29 while participant was on study drug
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize the PK (absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion) of the study drug lapatinib in the participant population. PK is defined as the concentration of drug in a participant's blood at certain time points after the drug was taken by mouth. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacokinetics were not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization at every 4-week assessment through end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: To (1) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in specific genes and the absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion (pharmacokinetics) of lapatinib, and to (2) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in select genes in DNA and the response (safety, efficacy, and tolerability) to lapatinib. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacogenetics were not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 4 weeks through end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Standard survey forms were completed by the participant at scheduled assessments to find out how the participant felt while on study. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, quality of life was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks to time of response to study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization until first documented evidence of partial or complete tumor response, measured using standard criteria (RECIST). Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to response was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from first documented evidence of response to study treatment and then every 8 weeks until disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: For those participants who show a complete or partial response, duration of response would be time from first documented evidence of response (complete or partial response by RECIST) until disease progression or death, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, duration of response was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks to disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization until the first documented sign of disease progression or death due to any cause, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to tumor progression was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks while on study drug and then every 3 months as follow-up until death
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is measured as the time from randomization until death due to any cause. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, overall survival was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Review of Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Histology (Cell Type) Using an Independent Review
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Anytime from Baseline through end of study
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the specific cell type (histology) of non-small cell lung cancer from participant's tissue samples, as determined by local pathologist, to the type determined by an independent pathologist. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, NSCLC histology was not analyzed.

other_outcome.measure: Tumor Response in the Non-Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment
other_outcome.description: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment (end of treatment for each participant was dependent on when the participant withdrew from study therapy due to disease progression, an adverse event or participant decision)

arm_group.description: Randomized, open-label, parallel group, 2-stage study to evaluate and compare 2 dose schedules (1500 mg once daily and 500 mg twice daily) of oral lapatinib.

reference.citation: Colin F Spraggs, Laura R Parham, Christine M. Hunt and Colin T Dollery. Characterisation of lapatinib-associated DILI cases by Class II HLA and UGT1A1*28 genotypes. [Clin Pharmacol Ther]. 2012;

Ross HJ, Blumenschein GR Jr, Aisner J, Damjanov N, Dowlati A, Garst J, Rigas JR, Smylie M, Hassani H, Allen KE, Leopold L, Zaks TZ, Shepherd FA. Randomized phase II multicenter trial of two schedules of lapatinib as first- or second-line monotherapy in patients with advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer. Clin Cancer Res. 2010 Mar 15;16(6):1938-49. doi: 10.1158/1078-0432.CCR-08-3328. Epub 2010 Mar 9.

class.title: Other non-small cell lung cancer type

outcome.title: Tumor Response in the Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
outcome.description: Disease progression and tumor response (number of participants achieving a complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]), using standardized criteria (Response evaluation criteria in solid tumors). CR, disappearance of all target lesions; PR, 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease, 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; stable disease, small changes that do not meet above criteria. Disease assessment was done at baseline and then every 8 weeks after starting treatment, until the participant discontinued treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment
outcome.population: Targeted Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had either the histological subtypes of adenocarcinoma with bronchioloalveolar carcinoma features or pure bronchioloalveolar carcinoma, or were never smokers with any histology of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

measure.title: Tumor Response in the Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
measure.description: Disease progression and tumor response (number of participants achieving a complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]), using standardized criteria (Response evaluation criteria in solid tumors). CR, disappearance of all target lesions; PR, 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease, 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; stable disease, small changes that do not meet above criteria. Disease assessment was done at baseline and then every 8 weeks after starting treatment, until the participant discontinued treatment.
measure.population: Targeted Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had either the histological subtypes of adenocarcinoma with bronchioloalveolar carcinoma features or pure bronchioloalveolar carcinoma, or were never smokers with any histology of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

outcome.title: Tumor Response in the Non-Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
outcome.description: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment (end of treatment for each participant was dependent on when the participant withdrew from study therapy due to disease progression, an adverse event or participant decision)
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment
outcome.population: Non-Targeted Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug but who did not meet the criteria for inclusion in the Targeted Population.

measure.title: Tumor Response in the Non-Targeted Population Through the End of Treatment
measure.description: Baseline and then every 8 weeks through end of treatment (end of treatment for each participant was dependent on when the participant withdrew from study therapy due to disease progression, an adverse event or participant decision)
measure.population: Non-Targeted Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug but who did not meet the criteria for inclusion in the Targeted Population.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Four Months in the Targeted Population
outcome.description: Percentage of participants in the Targeted Population, at 4 months after starting study drug, who were alive and without disease progression.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks up to four months

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Four Months in the Targeted Population
measure.description: Percentage of participants in the Targeted Population, at 4 months after starting study drug, who were alive and without disease progression.

analysis.estimate_desc: Percentage of surviving participants who were progression free 4 months after the date of randomization
Percentage of surviving participants who were progression free 4 months after the date of randomization

outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks up to four months

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Four Months in the Non-Targeted Population
measure.description: Percentage of participants in the Non-Targeted Population, at 4 months after starting study drug, who were alive and without disease progression.
measure.population: Non-Targeted Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug but who did not meet the criteria for inclusion in the Targeted Population.

analysis.estimate_desc: Percentage of surviving participants who were progression free 4 months after the date of randomization

outcome.description: To further characterize the participant population, these biomarkers could be tested: serum levels of ErbB1 and ErbB2; intra-tumoral expression of ErbB1, ErbB2, etc.; mutations in ErbB1, ErbB2, and k-ras. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, serum biomarkers were not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to disease progression (for serum biomarkers) or until analyses of tumor tissue samples

measure.title: The Number of Participants Who Showed Certain Biomarkers in Their Serum or Tumor Tissue
measure.description: To further characterize the participant population, these biomarkers could be tested: serum levels of ErbB1 and ErbB2; intra-tumoral expression of ErbB1, ErbB2, etc.; mutations in ErbB1, ErbB2, and k-ras. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, serum biomarkers were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Lapatinib
outcome.description: To characterize the PK (absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion) of the study drug lapatinib in the participant population. PK is defined as the concentration of drug in a participant’s blood at certain time points after the drug was taken by mouth. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacokinetics were not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to time of PK period completed: Day 1 (first dose) and Days 2, 28, and 29 while participant was on study drug

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Lapatinib
measure.description: To characterize the PK (absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion) of the study drug lapatinib in the participant population. PK is defined as the concentration of drug in a participant’s blood at certain time points after the drug was taken by mouth. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacokinetics were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Pharmacogenetics (PgX)
outcome.description: To (1) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in specific genes and the absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion (pharmacokinetics) of lapatinib, and to (2) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in select genes in DNA and the response (safety, efficacy, and tolerability) to lapatinib. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacogenetics were not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization at every 4-week assessment through end of treatment

measure.title: Pharmacogenetics (PgX)
measure.description: To (1) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in specific genes and the absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion (pharmacokinetics) of lapatinib, and to (2) investigate the relationship between genetic variants in select genes in DNA and the response (safety, efficacy, and tolerability) to lapatinib. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, pharmacogenetics were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Quality of Life
outcome.description: Standard survey forms were completed by the participant at scheduled assessments to find out how the participant felt while on study. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, quality of life was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and then every 4 weeks through end of treatment

measure.title: Quality of Life
measure.description: Standard survey forms were completed by the participant at scheduled assessments to find out how the participant felt while on study. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, quality of life was not analyzed.

outcome.title: Time to Response
outcome.description: Time from randomization until first documented evidence of partial or complete tumor response, measured using standard criteria (RECIST). Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to response was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks to time of response to study drug

measure.title: Time to Response
measure.description: Time from randomization until first documented evidence of partial or complete tumor response, measured using standard criteria (RECIST). Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to response was not analyzed.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: For those participants who show a complete or partial response, duration of response would be time from first documented evidence of response (complete or partial response by RECIST) until disease progression or death, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, duration of response was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: Time from first documented evidence of response to study treatment and then every 8 weeks until disease progression or death

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: For those participants who show a complete or partial response, duration of response would be time from first documented evidence of response (complete or partial response by RECIST) until disease progression or death, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, duration of response was not analyzed.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression
outcome.description: Time from randomization until the first documented sign of disease progression or death due to any cause, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to tumor progression was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks to disease progression or death

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression
measure.description: Time from randomization until the first documented sign of disease progression or death due to any cause, if sooner. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, time to tumor progression was not analyzed.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival is measured as the time from randomization until death due to any cause. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, overall survival was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization and then every 8 weeks while on study drug and then every 3 months as follow-up until death

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival is measured as the time from randomization until death due to any cause. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, overall survival was not analyzed.

outcome.title: Review of Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Histology (Cell Type) Using an Independent Review
outcome.description: Comparison of the specific cell type (histology) of non-small cell lung cancer from participant’s tissue samples, as determined by local pathologist, to the type determined by an independent pathologist. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, NSCLC histology was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: Anytime from Baseline through end of study

measure.title: Review of Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Histology (Cell Type) Using an Independent Review
measure.description: Comparison of the specific cell type (histology) of non-small cell lung cancer from participant’s tissue samples, as determined by local pathologist, to the type determined by an independent pathologist. Based on the interim analysis at the end of Stage 1, and predefined stopping rules for futility, further enrollment into the study was stopped due to lack of efficacy on both treatment arms; therefore, NSCLC histology was not analyzed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Based on interim analysis and predefined stopping rules for futility, the study was discontinued due to lack of efficacy. At that time, no additional participants were added; enrolled participants could continue on treatment, following the protocol.
